conclusion: Treat end a as lying essentially on the rotation axis O (its distance from O is negligible).
For a small element of the rod at a distance r from that axis, the tangential speed is v = ω r.
The motional emf contributed by this element in the uniform field B (directed into the page) is dε = B v dr = B ω r dr.
Integrate from r = 0 (at a) to r = 4L (at b): ε = ∫₀^{4L} B ω r dr = B ω [½ r²]₀^{4L} = ½ B ω (4L)² = 8 B ω L².
Using the right-hand rule for the given clockwise rotation and field direction, charges are driven so that end b is positive relative to end a.
The potential difference between the ends of the rotating rod is U_{ab} = 8 B ω L² (b positive with respect to a).
